    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public java.lang.Object execute(java.lang.Object input,
                                SCUIMashupMetaData mashupMetaData,
                                SCUIContext uiContext)
        Description copied from interface: ISCUIMashup
        This method should be implemented by all mashup classes. This method is invoked during mashup call. It is recommended that any business logic which needs to be executed during one server call should be performed in this method. Mashups are authorized and transaction handling for mashups is done by framework if mashup is set to transactional.

        Note: Implementation classes are not supposed to change mashupMetaData passed to execute method. Its just a read-only Property.

        Execute method should check the validity and integrity of the input data. If any error is found in the input, this method should throw a SCUIMashupException. A SCUIMashupException can be decorated with various validation errors found in the input.
        Mashup caller should handle such exceptions and convert them to useful data which can further be used to notify invalid input fields on the UI.

        input mashupMetaData Mashup meta data (read-only) uiContext Object SCUIMashupException
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ISCUIMashup

      • massageInput

        public org.w3c.dom.Element massageInput(org.w3c.dom.Element inputEl,
                                        SCUIMashupMetaData mashupMetaData,
                                        SCUIContext uiContext)
        This method is protected and currently does nothing but returns the same input. Any class extending SCUIRestAPIManager can extend this method and write custom logic of massaging input before actual Rest API is called. inputEl mashupMetaData uiContext massaged input

      • massageOutput

        public org.w3c.dom.Element massageOutput(org.w3c.dom.Element outEl,
                                         SCUIMashupMetaData mashupMetaData,
                                         SCUIContext uiContext)
        This method is protected and currently does noting but returns the same output. Any class extending SCUIRestAPIManager can extend this method and write custom logic of massaging output from actual XAPI invocation. outEl mashupMetaData uiContext massaged output
